comments.comment: Hi. I ran into the same issue today. I first tried to install Kubeflow with Istio 1.7.4, which resulted in the same error described by you. After a downgrade to Istio 1.6.13 I was able to complete the installation. The CONFIG_URI used in the instructions mentioned by you points to <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v1.1-branch/kfdef/kfctl_azure.v1.1.0.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v1.1-branch/kfdef/kfctl_azure.v1.1.0.yaml</denchmark-link> , which contains the following comment: "It is expected to have Istio 1.6.x installed in istio-system namespace" Maybe that also helps you to perform the installation? It seems that further adjustments are needed to make it compatible with Istio 1.7.x. Best regards, Torbre16

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/torbre16>@torbre16</denchmark-link>
Hi. I ran into the same issue today. I first tried to install Kubeflow with Istio 1.7.4, which resulted in the same error described by you. After a downgrade to Istio 1.6.13 I was able to complete the installation. The CONFIG_URI used in the instructions mentioned by you points to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v1.1-branch/kfdef/kfctl_azure.v1.1.0.yaml, which contains the following comment: "It is expected to have Istio 1.6.x installed in istio-system namespace" Maybe that also helps you to perform the installation? It seems that further adjustments are needed to make it compatible with Istio 1.7.x. Best regards, Torbre16
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/torbre16>@torbre16</denchmark-link> ! It did fix the issue.
